edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.treasure_hunter

Class GameComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.games.treasure_hunter.GameComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class GameComponent
extends javax.swing.JComponent
    A component that draws the map for the Treasure Hunter game.
    Version:
    for UCSB CS56, F17, 11/07/2017
    Author:
    Alex Wood (for CS56, W12, UCSB, 2/16/2012), Danielle Dodd and George Lieu, Lisa Liao and Patrick Vidican, Yusuf Alnawakhtha and Sang Min Oh
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Draws all components onto the screen. All of the tiles and the player sprite are drawn onto the screen. When a player finds a treasure, draws the "TREASURE # FOUND" message onto the screen. Keeps track of the timer and draws the "YOU LOSE" message onto the screen if the player runs out of time.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object

      • updatePlayer

        public void updatePlayer()
        Updates the player sprite on the map.

      • loadMap

        public void loadMap(java.lang.String name)
        Loads the map from the layout specified in a text document. Each type of tile is loaded from the resources directory as a BufferedImage. According to the tile specified in the map layout, the Character that specifies the tile is stored in ArrayList<Character> tiletypes and the respective BufferedImage map tile is stored in ArrayList<BufferedImage> tiles. The ArrayList<BufferedImage> tiles is used later by paintComponent() in order to draw the tiles on the screen.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the text tile that stores the layout of the map

      • checkMove

        public void checkMove(int xTile,
                      int yTile)
        Checks the move that the player made. Makes sure that the player stays within the bounds of the map ([0,11] width x [0,9] height). Provides collision detection in order to ensure that the player does not move through rocks (the player, however, is allowed to move through bushes). Checks the timer and prevents the player from moving once the time is up. Checks whether the player is standing on a tile with a hidden treasure. If a treasure is found, the message "TREASURE # FOUND" is displayed.
        Parameters:
        xTile - The x-coordinate of the player's location on the map
        yTile - The y-coordinate of the player's location on the map

      • setMessage

        public void setMessage(int treasureNumber)
        Sets the message that will be displayed once a treasure is found.
        Parameters:
        treasureNumber - The number of the treasure that is found

      • setMessageFinal

        public void setMessageFinal(boolean gameWon)
        Sets the message that will be displayed if the player wins the game (i.e. finds all treasures on the map).
        Parameters:
        gameWon - A value that indicates whether the game is won or not

      • loadPlayer

        public void loadPlayer(Player player,
                       java.lang.String name)
        Load and initialize the player sprite. It is used by the go() method in the GameGui class.
        Parameters:
        player - The player object
        name - The name of the player

      • loadTreasure

        public void loadTreasure(java.util.ArrayList<Treasure> treasures)
        Initializes the treasures and sets them on the map.
        Parameters:
        treasures - The list of treasures that are to be placed on the map
